Election module¶

class Election.Election(candidates_file: str, ballots_file: str)¶

Bases: object

Main program for project 1

Reads data from files and prepares and stores list of sets of ballots. Then, it can determine the winner of the

eliminated¶

Contains ids of candidates that were eliminated on previous rounds

Type

Set

candidates¶

Contains list of candidate names using their ids as indices for the list

Type

DoublyLinkedList

ballots_received¶

Stores the total amount of ballots received (includes blank and invalid ballots)

Type

int

invalid_ballots¶

Stores the amount of invalid ballots

Type

int

blank_ballots¶

Stores the amount of blank ballots

Type

int

ballots¶

Stores ballots in sets inside a list. Each set will contain ballots that have the same candidate with rank #1. The specific candidate that has #1 across all ballots in that set will be indicated by the set’s position within the ballot’s list. The index corresponds to the candidate’s id

Type

DoublyLinkedList[Set[Ballot]]

__init__(candidates_file: str, ballots_file: str) → NoReturn¶

Extract data from ballots and candidate files

See Election.Election.parse_candidate_file() and Election.Election.parse_ballot_file() for more details as to how this data is processed

Parameters

  • candidates_file (str) – File from which candidate data will be extracted

  • ballots_file (str) – File from which ballots data will be extracted

calculate_amount_votes(considered_candidates: Collection[int], rank: int) → List[int]¶

Helper function that calculates the amount of votes considered candidates have for a particular rank

Parameters

  • considered_candidates (set[int]) – The candidate ids for the candidates that are still being considered for the election (i.e. they have not been eliminated)

  • rank (int) – The particular rank we want to count votes for

Returns

List of votes for each candidate for this particular rank

Return type

amount_votes(list[int])

determineWinner() → NoReturn¶

Determine election winner in by eliminating candidates until one has over 50% of #1 votes

Consists of multiple rounds of elimination where if a candidate does not have over 50% of #1 votes, a candidate will be eliminated. The candidate with the least amount of votes for rank #1 will be eliminated. If there’s a tie, the candidate with the least amount of votes for rank #2 will be eliminated. etc.

parse_ballot_file(file_name: str) → NoReturn¶

Receives ballots file and extracts and stores ballots in list of sets

Each line of the ballots file will contain only 1 ballot number followed by its fotes. After interpreting the ballots, each ballot is stored in a list of sets. Each ballot in a set in the list belongs to the candidate that has rank #1 within that ballot.

Parameters

file_name (str) – Name of the CSV file where the ballot number and votes are stored

Note

The format is as follows:

  • ballot_number_1,candidate:1,candidate:2,…,candidate:k

  • ballot_number_2,candidate:1,candidate:2,…,candidate:k

  • …

parse_candidate_file(file_name: str) → NoReturn¶

Receives candidates file and extracts and stores candidate names in list

The index where each candidate is stored corresponds to that specific candidate’s id

Parameters

file_name (str) – Name of the CSV file where the candidate names and ids are stored

Note

The format is as follows:

  • Candidate1 Name, 1

  • Candidate2 Name, 2

  • …
